step1.sentence: When the company faced a sudden budget cut, the entire team had to meet the challenge of delivering the same results with fewer resources.

step2.story: Sarah had always been a dependable project manager, but leading a cross-continental team was something entirely new. She knew she had to meet this challenge head-on if she wanted to prove herself. After weeks of late-night calls and careful coordination, the project launched on time and exceeded expectations.

step3.story: When the small-town bakery won a contract to supply pastries for a major tech conference, owner James felt a mix of excitement and dread. He had never produced more than two hundred items a day, and this order called for three thousand in a single weekend. His daughter Elena suggested they bring in her culinary school friends to help. Together, the makeshift team turned the cramped kitchen into a well-oiled machine, each person handling a different station. James realized that the only way to meet a challenge this big was to trust the people around him. By Sunday morning, every last croissant was boxed, loaded, and delivered—still warm.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: '도전을 만나다'라는 뜻으로, 어려운 상황이나 과제에 직면한다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 단순히 '마주하다'가 아니라, 어려운 상황에 적극적으로 대응하고 극복하려는 의지를 담아 사용합니다. '도전에 맞서다', '난관을 헤쳐나가다'에 가깝습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'meet'은 고대 영어 'metan(만나다, 마주하다)'에서 유래했으며, 단순한 만남뿐 아니라 '정면으로 맞서다'라는 뜻도 갖고 있습니다. 'challenge'와 결합하여 '도전에 응하다'라는 의미의 관용 표현이 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 이 표현은 긍정적이고 적극적인 태도를 내포합니다. 도전을 회피하지 않고 받아들인다는 뉘앙스가 있어, 비즈니스나 자기계발 맥락에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Our team is ready to meet any challenge that comes our way.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 우리 팀은 어떤 도전이 오더라도 맞설 준비가 되어 있습니다.
